div.l: And whanne the mele is sackid ⁊and I bounde
This Iohn goth forth ⁊and fynt his hors aweye
And gan to crie harow ⁊and wel awey
Our hors is lorn̄ Aleyn for cokkis bonys
Step out on thi feet com thennys at onys
Allas our wardeyn hath his palfrey lorn̄
This Aleyn al forgat bothe mele ⁊and corn̄
As was oute of mynde his husbondry
What whilk wey is he gon̄ he gan crye
The wif com rennynge ynward at a ronne
She said allas your hors goth to fenne
With wilde maris as faste as he may go
Vnthank come on his hand þᵗat bond ham so
And he þᵗat bettir sholde haue knyt þe Reyne
Allas qᵈuod Iohn allas for cristis peyne
Ley doun thi swerd and I wil myn alswa
I is ful swift got woot as is A Ro
Be cockis herte he shal not a scape vs bathe
Whi ne had thou put þe capil in to þe lathe
Ille hail be god Aleyn thou is A fonne
These seli clerkis han wel faste y ronne
Toward the fenne bothe Aleyn ⁊and eke Iohn
And when þe myllere sey þey were goon̄
He half a busshel of her corn hath take
And bad his wiff go knede it in a cake
And saide I trow þe clerkis were a ferd
Ȝit can a myllere make A clerkis berd
For al her art ȝit let hem go her wey
Lo where he goth ȝe lat þe children pley
They gete hem nouȝt so liȝtly be my croune
Thise seli clerkis rennyn vp and doune
With kepe kepe stond stond Iossa ware derere
Ga wisli þou and I shal kepe hym here
But shortly til it was verili nyȝt
They coude not þouȝ þey dede al her myȝt
